messages.message: I see that changes were made to the provisioner script - how do we know what operations and services are available to pass as args?
It supports the same operations, if you try one it doesn’t like it will spit them all at you.
but i used to read the help to see what was available
maybe there's a bug with mine? i don't see any options provided
It might have just been poorly implemented in the new syntax. :smile:
as in, do i need to know the sevice names by memroy?
ideally i could look it up since the names are not super intuitive
Yeah, you still can, it just isn’t as immediately accessible.
I think a help handler would be good here.
yupyup, i can add it
i actually thought help autoamtically printed the choices if that's available
I thought so too
bah

```vagrant@vagrant:/instabase/data-services/ocr-services/ocr-ari$ python /instabase/provisioner.py start testing
usage: provisioner.py [-h] [--as-docker] operation service [service ...]
provisioner.py: error: argument service: invalid choice: 'testing' (choose from 'api-server-apps', 'apps-server', 'account-tservice', 'file-tservice', 'mount-tservice', 'repo-tservice', 'webapp', 'celery-core-tasks', 'celery-webdriver-tasks', 'api-server', 'celery-app-tasks', 'table-tservice', 'worker-image-tasks', 'celery-flower', 'refiner-tservice', 'pdf-tservice', 'ocr-ari', 'stanford-nlp', 'rabbitmq', 'redis', 'all')```
It does if you provide a choice it doesn’t like
oh i think it does maybe if it's not a positional arg?
Yeah this is totally my fault. I put the info in the PR but didn’t make show this info in the help. >.<
no worries - it is overall a change for the better :slightly_smiling_face: discovered by my avid use of provisioner
i can update the help print out
What do you think about making it so the default is just the description, but a subhandler to dump options?
i don't htink i follow
something like `provisioner.py status help`
oh like not --help to dump options,
ooo i see
I think I am describing it wrong
hmm, i would try to use the standard --help
for ease of use
Yeah that probably makes more sense
Because it isn’t really subcommands, I was thinking like `git`
i would just dump th eoptions in the help string
but these are arguments
yeah

```
positional arguments:
  operation    Specifies the action to perform on a list of services.
  service      Specifies the service(s) to perform the operation on. Options
               are ['refiner-tservice', 'celery-core-tasks', 'celery-flower',
               'ocr-ari', 'apps-server', 'celery-app-tasks', 'table-tservice',
               'file-tservice', 'redis', 'stanford-nlp', 'account-tservice',
               'repo-tservice', 'pdf-tservice', 'rabbitmq', 'worker-image-
               tasks', 'webapp', 'api-server-apps', 'mount-tservice', 'celery-
               webdriver-tasks', 'api-server', 'all']
```
